intro: Cleretum hestermalense, commonly known as the Hestermalense cleretum, is a rare and endemic plant species native to a specific region in South America. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and distinctive, lance-shaped leaves with a waxy surface. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, blooming during the wet season. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded, humid environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
